benchmark_details.name: VISBIAS
benchmark_details.overview: VISBIAS evaluates explicit and implicit social biases exhibited by Vision-Language Models (VLMs) through four distinct assessment scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate and evaluate both explicit and implicit social biases in Vision-Language Models.

data.source: Real-world images and crowdsourced personal information forms.
data.annotation: Manual annotation with human input for bias evaluation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on response distributions of the models during bias evaluation.
methodology.interpretation: JSD and KLD values indicate the degree of bias present in model outputs.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison to existing benchmark results not specified.
methodology.validation: Quantitative results validated through human assessment and statistical analysis.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The benchmark includes demographic breakdowns across gender and racial lines.
targeted_risks.harm: The recognition of harmful stereotypes perpetuated by models.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Images used are publicly available and were chosen to minimize privacy concerns.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Data collection procedures were transparent, and human evaluators were compensated.
